column1: I joined @TeamCavuto today to discuss the #COVID19 pandemic and other news of the day. You can watch our conversation below: https://t.co/8GptLXGAD9
I’m joining @TeamCavuto at 1:05 pm ET/10:05 am PT on @FoxBusiness to discuss ongoing coronavirus stimulus negotiations and other news of the day. I hope you can tune in!

President Trump’s termination of Secretary Esper not only hurts our national security and the DOD's critical role in the development and distribution of hundreds of millions of COVID-19 vaccines it also makes the transfer of knowledge on these issues even more challenging.

The United States continues to hit its largest daily increase in new COVID-19 cases since the start of the pandemic. Please continue to wear your mask and take the necessary precautions to keep you and your loved ones safe from this virus.

It's a new day. Congratulations President-Elect Joe Biden and Vice President-Elect Kamala Harris. I look forward to working with you to defeat the COVID-19 pandemic provide affordable health care for every American and help build our economy back better than ever before.

I joined Fredricka Whitfield on CNN to discuss the COVID-19 pandemic the Presidential election and the ongoing stimulus negotiations between the White House and Congress. You can watch our full discussion below: https://t.co/ErR3AiJVyx

Americans are hurting and they need a new coronavirus stimulus package immediately. Mr. President: Stop playing politics and come back to the negotiating table immediately. House Democrats stand ready to find a true bipartisan compromise.   https://t.co/d91h6N0R9U

Patti and I are wishing the President and First Lady a full and speedy recovery from COVID-19 and our prayers are with every person that has been afflicted by this virus.   Please wear a mask physical distance and stay safe.
On February 7 President Trump told Bob Woodward COVID-19 was “deadly stuff” and “worse than the flu.” But one month later he was telling the American people this. #TrumpKnew https://t.co/MQCylZyLP8
My office received a letter from the Yuba County Board of Supervisors outlining the need for federal financial aid to all counties in the next COVID-19 relief package. https://t.co/g003oltFCS

President Trump has spread falsehoods and misinformation about voting by mail and we will not stand for it. Voting by mail is the safest and most reliable method to vote as we face the coronavirus pandemic.

Almond growers throughout our district are hurting from the impacts coronavirus has had on their ability to make a living. I'm advocating on their behalf for much-needed federal support. Read more below:  https://t.co/k9pH144XRn
Here’s how far #COVID19 can spread if you don’t wear a mask. Do your part. Wear a mask. Save lives. https://t.co/3mEvz7OMxK

I'm pleased that the House Armed Services Committee has unanimously approved the #FY21NDAA. This bill gives our service members a 3% pay raise empowers the military to address the #COVID19Pandemic and supports military training infrastructure logistics and readiness.
#COVID19 is not going to “just disappear” as the President claims. Please continue to wear a mask practice physical distancing and stay home to the extent possible. https://t.co/ARoOlK3A9c

ATTN 3rd Distrist residents in Glenn Sacramento and Solano counties: due to the alarming rise of #COVID19 in the community @CAPublicHealth has ordered indoor operations to close at the facilities highlighted below. Please wear a mask and stay home to the extent possible. https://t.co/htpSYB27N0

I just voted for H.R. 7301 to address the needs of renters and homeowners that have been harmed by the #COVID19 pandemic. 32% of renters were unable to cover rent at the beginning of June. This bill will provide them the support and relief they need. I urge its swift adoption.
#COVID19 is still here and is spreading rapidly. Wear a mask practice social distancing and stay home to the extent possible. https://t.co/a80pvIx1iz

The #COVID19 Pandemic underscores how critical it is for every American to have access to good quality and affordable health care. That's why I'm voting to pass the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Enhancement Act today.

Today during the #COVID19Pandemic Trump and 18 GOP governors and attorneys general filed a SCOTUS brief in their effort to repeal the ACA. This would strip health care away from 23 million Americans during the global pandemic. We should expand health coverage not cut it.

As coronavirus cases continue to spike throughout the U.S. the Trump administration has decided to end federal support for testing across five states. This is unconscionable. We need to ramp up testing not cut it. https://t.co/CjMEqHu4He

Reminder that the #COVID19Pandemic is still here and cases are spiking in California.                     ✔️Wear a mask ✔️Social distance (a minimum of six feet) ✔️Stay home to the extent possible  Do it for your own health and the health of your loved ones.
@GavinNewsom is delivering an update on the #COVID19Pandemic. You can watch live below: https://t.co/ZaTr52GaLW

He offered no words of sympathy to the Floyd family or the families of over 100000 Americans who have died of COVID-19. Instead of pulling Americans together the President’s actions and lack of moral leadership rip at the core of our nation’s fabric.

...coronavirus-related outlays and revenue loss and pay our health care workers police fire transportation EMS teachers and other vital workers who keep us safe and are in danger of losing their jobs.  I urge my colleagues to vote yes.   https://t.co/VLmyZck2w4

To receive a coronavirus stimulus check by direct deposit eligible Americans must submit their banking information through the “Get My Payment” tool on the IRS website by today. https://t.co/pwV0Nhnsc6
As we face the coronavirus pandemic it’s more important than ever to have a robust domestic drug manufacturing industry.
I will be hosting a telephone town hall with local health and employment experts on May 5 at 3:00 p.m. PST to discuss the coronavirus and how to access resources.

The Pentagon’s political leadership must spend its time and effort dealing with the coronavirus that is spreading through the military. Reinstate Crozier now and get on with the work of maintaining the health and readiness of our servicemembers and their families.
I will not stop fighting for improved testing and support for those at risk of contracting the coronavirus. https://t.co/9u32Zpetyt

Sadly 11 members of our community at a skilled nursing facility in Woodland have died due to complications with COVID-19. My heart is with them and their loved ones as they deal with this unthinkable loss.

The coronavirus pandemic has put an unprecedented strain on our society and our nation requires a significant scaling of testing and contact tracing in order to flatten the curve and lift stay-at-home orders.
Today I introduced legislation that would mobilize America’s service organizations to significantly expand testing and contact tracing for the coronavirus pandemic.

I will be hosting a telephone town hall on the coronavirus TODAY at 2:30pm PST. If you would like to participate please call (855) 962-1140 at the time of the event or you can stream the event at https://t.co/eOGU7IxmXO and https://t.co/2qQoV6ISKx. https://t.co/hSMprxmmZn

Health care professionals interested in providing support to their community during the coronavirus pandemic can sign up for the California Health Corps. Your expertise is incredibly valuable to ensure our health care system isn’t overwhelmed. https://t.co/HxYAAA63N0
Small businesses and nonprofit organizations impacted by the coronavirus pandemic can access new financial resources today to help cover overhead and payroll.
Today on #worldhealthday I honor the nurses doctors and health workers who are on the front lines of the battle against coronavirus. Their sacrifice to our country will never be forgotten.

Today is #NationalDoctorsDay. As we face the global coronavirus pandemic doctors and health care workers have been on the front lines caring for the most sick and vulnerable among us. They risk their health and safety so that we can feel safe. https://t.co/FXTFtB1MCw

Unfortunately during this public health crisis scammers are taking advantage of fears surrounding the coronavirus. Please follow the links below to find out how you can protect yourself against these scams: https://t.co/x5WlzgWlgL   https://t.co/MGBkSbzQB2
We all must do our part to stop the spread of COVID-19. Learn more at https://t.co/BvCgq4ov6b https://t.co/VUJ4GiJ0M8

Older adults and people with underlying health conditions including cancer may be at higher risk for more serious complications from #COVID19. It’s important for everyone to take precautions to keep the most vulnerable populations healthy. #CongressionalFamilies https://t.co/ywhQcf3FiF

If you are a healthy individual it is important to donate blood as we face the coronavirus pandemic. Volunteer blood donors are the only source of blood for those in need and just one donation can save the lives of up to three people.

I joined @RepJoeNeguse and 65 of my Democratic colleagues to ensure Secretary of State Pompeo takes action to bring home Americans that are stuck abroad during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/NUAg7ASJeH

The telephone town hall for my constituents on the novel coronavirus is beginning shortly. Please follow this link https://t.co/CevJ1Td2Os for a livestream. Participants can join the call by dialing (855) 962-1140.
As we face the coronavirus pandemic I want to make sure that my constituents have access to all the resources they need to stay healthy and safe. https://t.co/xHaMU1PDUf

I will be joined by local health officials to listen to the community’s concerns and answer their questions related to the novel coronavirus.  Participants can join the call by dialing (855) 962-1140.

I am hosting a telephone town hall for my constituents on the coronavirus at 6:30 pm PT TODAY March 23. The event is free and every resident of California’s 3rd Congressional District is invited to participate.
I will be joined by local health officials to listen to the community’s concerns and answer their questions related to the novel coronavirus.  Participants can join the call by calling (855) 962-1140

I am hosting a telephone town hall for my constituents on the novel coronavirus at 6:30 pm PT on Monday March 23. The event is free and every resident of California’s 3rd Congressional District is invited to participate.
Due to the novel coronavirus IRS has moved tax day from April 15 to July 15. Please see more information below: https://t.co/7MoUgHomyl
U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD) announced it will suspend all evictions and foreclosures for 60 days during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/bYdWpcIwDw
Davis Residents: The City of Davis is urging residents to shelter in place due to the coronavirus outbreak.

Yolo County Residents: To address coronavirus mitigation-related barriers to food access for low-income seniors and other vulnerable populations in Yolo County Yolo Food Bank will begin a free home-delivered food service this Monday.
Davis Residents: All Davis Joint Unified Schools will be closed beginning Monday March 16 through Sunday April 12 2020 in light of COVID-19. https://t.co/zAlj41FB7Y
I am joining .@RepKatiePorter and 80 of my colleagues to demand that @US_FDA and @HHSGov expedite assistance on new and simple tests for COVID-19. We cannot wait any longer. https://t.co/ns31hly29v

I joined Cuomo Prime Time last night to discuss the novel coronavirus and other news of the day. You can watch our full conversation below.  You can go to https://t.co/w1R3B2Chzt to stay up-to-date on the virus and what you can do to protect yourself. https://t.co/n9o9OsOt9D

Patti and I are saddened to hear about the passing of a woman in Sacramento County. As we face uncertain and trying times let us keep all those affected by the coronavirus and their loved ones in our thoughts and prayers.   https://t.co/2IQgrAQVvP
I’m joining @donlemon and @ChrisCuomo on @CNN at 1 am ET/10 pm PT to discuss tonight’s election results coronavirus and other news of the day.
.@GavinNewsom is providing an update on California's response to the novel coronavirus outbreak in our state. You can watch the update live below: https://t.co/30xVOvE64Z
I joined Brooke Baldwin today to discuss the novel coronavirus and the steps we can take to protect ourselves from the virus. You can watch the full conversation below: https://t.co/RhUkL4bUR1
I'm joining @BrookeBCNN at 3:30 pm ET/12:30 pm PT to discuss coronavirus and other news of the day. You can watch live on @CNNnewsroom.

I joined CNN this morning to discuss coronavirus and the steps we can all take to prevent the spread of this virus. Right now every American has the responsibility to wash their hands and avoid touching their eyes nose or mouth with unwashed hands. https://t.co/AjSv2bxt9R
I'm joining @jimsciutto on @CNNnewsroom at 9:40 am ET/6:40 am PT to discuss coronavirus the Presidential election and other news of the day. I hope you can tune in!
It was an honor to join @SpeakerPelosi in a bill signing ceremony to send the bipartisan $8.3 billion Coronavirus Emergency Response Package to the President’s desk. https://t.co/HqtVontxZy
I’m joining @SpeakerPelosi to send the coronavirus emergency response package to the President’s desk. https://t.co/o4MDIOPmya
I'm joining @TeamCavuto on @FoxBusiness at 1:45 pm ET/10:45 am PT to discuss coronavirus the Presidential election and other news of the day.

I just voted to pass an $8.3 billion emergency coronavirus package which includes support for state and local health agencies vaccine and treatment development and loans for affected small businesses.
I’m joining @BillHemmer on Fox News in a few moments to discuss the new bill in Congress to help combat the spread of coronavirus as well as other news of the day.

I joined The Situation Room this evening to deliver an update on the coronavirus quarantine at Travis AFB the status of the virus in our community and what you can do to minimize your risk of exposure. You can watch the full update below: https://t.co/e8Fd4qHpDc
I'm joining @wolfblitzer on @CNNSitRoom at 6 pm ET/3 pm PT to discuss the coronavirus and other news of the day.
I spoke with @CBSEveningNews about the Coronavirus outbreak and what we can do to protect ourselves from exposure. https://t.co/27lVPw8Cos
I’m joining @FOX40 at 10:15 pm PT to deliver an update on the Coronavirus and the steps we can all take to minimize our risk.

2/3 There is no threat of physical violence—but he can expect a strong verbal altercation.   I will continue working to ensure our communities have the testing kits and resources necessary to successfully address the Coronavirus crisis.
I joined @HallieJackson on @MSNBC this morning to discuss a briefing I received from the administration this morning on the Coronavirus. You can watch our discussion below: https://t.co/qoc22zUvjc
Please see a checklist below on the steps we can all take to stop the spread of the COVID-19 strain of Coronavirus in our communities. https://t.co/dCQ7g3zoS0

I’m joining @HallieJackson on @MSNBC at 10:15 am ET/7:15 am PT to discuss the COVIN-19 Coronavirus patient from Solano County who contracted the virus without a known source as well as other news of the day.

Your CDC won’t allow CA to use its own capable labs to test for Coronavirus and has provided just 200 test kits for a state of 40 million people. That inaction is a horrific disservice to public health and safety and we will not stand for it. https://t.co/TfKXnGxxFj
Trump’s CDC won't allow California to use their labs to do testing for Coronavirus. It is reprehensible it is dangerous and god help us it could be deadly. https://t.co/nIJP7CqZ4D
I’m joining @TheLastWord with @Lawrence at 10 ET/7 PT to discuss Coronavirus and information I’ve learned about CDC’s handling of the situation. You can watch live on @MSNBC.
I’m joining @marthamaccallum on Fox News in a few moments to discuss the Coronavirus.

I joined Fox Business earlier provide an update on the instance of "community spread" of the COVID-19 strain of coronavirus in my district.   Watch the full discussion below:   https://t.co/DgjdOo4yhA
I'm delivering an update on the Coronavirus case from Solano County and more on @OutFrontCNN this evening at 7:15 pm ET/4:15 pm PT. You can watch live on @CNN.
I'm delivering an update on the Coronavirus case from Solano County and more on @AftertheBell this afternoon at 4:15 pm ET/1:15 pm PT. You can watch live on @FoxBusiness.
Below is acomprehensive update on the Solano County that is being treated for the COVID-19 strain of Coronavirus.   https://t.co/s3BXxT546e

I joined @ChrisCuomo tonight to discuss the possible “community spread” of Coronavirus in our region as well as the necessary steps my fellow lawmakers and I must take to ensure we prepare our country for the Coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/qtakfRJNhq

I joined @ShannonBream tonight to discuss the possible “community spread” of Coronavirus in our region as well as the necessary steps my fellow lawmakers and I must take to ensure we prepare our country for the Coronavirus outbreak. https://t.co/Aj6OF5ujkp
I’m joining @ChrisCuomo on @CuomoPrimeTime in a moment to discuss the Coronavirus and the resident of Solano County that has tested positive for the virus.

1/2 I am aware of reports that a Solano County resident has tested positive for COVID-19 strain of Coronavirus. I am in close contact with the U.S. Centers for Disease Control and the State of California and will pass along any updates as they become available.
